messages.subject: may i vent?
messages.msgSnippet: sorry about my last two posts. I forgot to change the sub line. This post reminds me of one of my best friends. Her house was always such a shambles, which I
messages.messageBody:
sorry about my last two posts. I forgot to change the sub line.

This post reminds me of one of my best friends. Her house was always such a
shambles, which I (and she) always attributed to a passel of boys and their
uber creative ways of messing things up. Hers was also the "neighborhood
hangout" which is how she wanted it. Now she's divorced and has a place of
her own, and except for the front room usually being presentable...it's very
similar to what it was when it was full of kids.

I *think* I'm neater than this. guess I'll know when the kids move out.

blessings, heidiC


>I will have no excuses for the messy house (except for dh, maybe).
>
>
>~~~
>
>My mother retired, and lives alone. A few years after her retirement,
>while
>I was visiting she said, "I used to think you kids were the reason the
>house
>was always a mess. Now I realize it was ME all along!" :)
>
>Karen
>
>www.badchair.net
>
>
